oai_dc:dc.dc:title: An uncertainty principle for real signals in the fractional Fourier transform domain
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: GADRE, VM
SHINDE, SUDARSHAN B
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: fourier transforms
gaussian processes
indeterminancy
signal representation
time-frequency analysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The fractional Fourier transform (FrFT) can be thought of as a generalization of the Fourier transform to rotate a signal representation by an arbitrary angle Î± in the time-frequency plane. A lower bound on the uncertainty product of signal representations in two FrFT domains for real signals is obtained, and it is shown that a Gaussian signal achieves the lower bound. The effect of shifting and scaling the signal on the uncertainty relation is discussed. An example is given in which the uncertainty relation for a real signal is obtained, and it is shown that this relation matches with that given by the uncertainty relation derived.
